resources.string: Learn WebTech
Start

The Learn WebTech app has objective to teach the main current web language, what is HTML 5. The application is in the form of a course with an initial content followed by a test in the form of a quiz question and answer with alternatives.
Below is a summary of language that will be covered in the course.
HTML is short for HyperText Markup Language, language for marking used to build web pages…
Learn
Correct
Continue
Points
Quiz
Example:
Html
Result

HTML is short for HyperText Markup Language, language for marking used to build web pages. HTML documents can be interpreted by browsers. 

HTML is based on the concept of hypertext. Hypertext are sets of elements, or we, linked by connections. These elements can be words, images, videos, audio, documents, etc. These elements connected form a large information network. 

To distribute information in a global way, there must be a language that is universally understood by various means of access. HTML is proposed to this language. Originally developed by Tim Berners-Lee HTML gained popularity when the Mosaic - browser developed by Marc Andreessen in the 1990s, has gained strength. From there, developers and browser makers used the HTML based, sharing the same conventions.
1. Characteristics
‣ HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.
‣ HTML is not a programming language, it is a markup language.
‣ A markup language is a collection of markup tags.
‣ HTML uses markup tags to describe Web pages.
2. Tags
‣ HTML markup tags are usually called HTML tags or just tags.
‣ HTML tags are keywords surrounded by angle brackets like <html>.
‣ HTML tags normally come in pairs, like and .
‣ The first tag in a pair is the start tag; the second tag is the end tag.
‣ Start and end tags are also called opening tags and closing tags.
3. Basic structure of an HTML document
First of all, it is important to bear in mind that:
‣ HTML documents describe Web pages.
‣ HTML documents contain HTML tags and plain text.
‣ HTML documents are also called Web pages.

The purpose of a Web browser is interpret HTML tags and display the your contents. Example: This is title the page

This is title the page
4. Understanding the structure

Your browser will interpret the html tags above. The opening tag <html> and closing </html> serve to tell the browser that this is an HTML document. The <head> </head> serve to set rules and formatting to the document, such as a title, coding, import scripts and libraries, etc. \n\nIt is important to know that all that stay within the <head> tag is not visible to the user, except for the <title> tag is the text that is on the page tab. Already, the <body> </body> defines all that is visible to the user, such as text, audio, images, tables, and everything we can find on a web page.
5. What you need to start developing HTML ?
‣ HTML editor, with Notepad, Gedit, Sublime Text, Atom, etc.
‣ Basic knowledge of html tags.
‣ Web browser to test the html pages.
‣ Save the document with the .html extension.
6. Fundamentals
Preview in browser:
HTML Headings
Because users may skim your pages by their headings, it is important to use headings to show the document structure. Headings are defined, from largest to smallest, with the <h1> to <h6> tags.

This is a Heading 1

This is a Heading 2

This is a Heading 3

This is a Heading 4

This is a Heading 5
This is a Heading 6
HTML Paragraphs

HTML paragraphs are defined with the

tag. Most browsers automatically put a line break and space after a

tag.

This is a paragraph 1.

This is a paragraph 2 .

This is a paragraph 3.
HTML Links
HTML links are defined with the <a> tag.
This is a link to the w3schools Web site.
HTML Images
HTML images are defined with the tag. It tells the browser where to find the image file and what size to display it, among other things.
HTML Comments
Comments can be inserted in the HTML code to make it more readable and understandable. Comments are ignored by the browser and are not displayed.
This is a regular paragraph
7. HTML Attributes
Attributes provide additional information about HTML elements.
‣ HTML elements can have attributes.
‣ Attributes provide additional information about the element.
‣ Attributes are always specified in the start tag.
‣ Attributes come in name/value pairs like: name=”value”.
Defining Attribute Values

Attribute values should always be enclosed within quotation marks. While "\""double quotes"\"" are the most common, single-style quotes (also called primes) are also allowed. In some rare situations, like when the attribute value itself includes quotation marks, it is necessary to use primes. For example: name="\'"John "\""Shotgun"\"" Nelson"\'". \n\nAs another example, HTML links are defined with the <a> tag. The Web address, surrounded by quotation marks, is the value of the attribute of the link element.
This is a link to the w3schools Web site.
Question 1 - About HTML 5:
Is a language for marking used to build web pages.
Is a language for marking used to stylization web pages.
Question 2 - About HTML tags:
The html tags are interpreted by the browser, which displays its contents.
The html tags are interpreted by the browser, which displays the tags and their content.
Question 3 - About the basic structure of an HTML document:
The tags are part of the basic structure of an HTML document is <html>, <head> and <body>.
The tags are part of the basic structure of an HTML document is <html>, <head> and <title>
Question 4 - About the structure definition of start and end tags.
The structure of the opening and closing tags correspond respectively to the </html> and <html>.
The structure of the opening and closing tags correspond respectively to the <html> and </html>.
Question 5 - About the tags of the basic structure of an HTML document:
The <html> tag tells the browser to that document is of type HTML . Your child tags are <head> and <body>, which serve respectively to set import scripts, and display content to the user.
The <html> tag tells the browser to that document is of type HTML . Your child tags are <head> and <body>, which serve respectively to display content to the user and set coding rules, for example.
Question 6 - About the extension of a html document:
HTML documents should have the .html extension, so that the browser can interpret the document as a hmtl page.
html document should be .web extension, so that the web browser can interpret the document and display to the user.
Question 7 - About the types of additional tags that can be incorporated into the element:
The <title> tag defines the main header of a web page to be displayed to the user .

The

tag defines paragraphs in a document , and are always placed in the of the document.
Question 8 - About <a> tag:
It"\'"s a tag for defining hyperlinks within an HTML document, the attribute that defines the path of the link is the href. For example Google .
It"\'"s a tag for defining hyperlinks within an HTML document, the attribute that defines the path of the link is called the link. For examploe Google .
Question 9 - About attribute values:
The values ​​for attributes such as name and href must be defined in single quotes "\'" or double "\"".
The values ​​for attributes such as name and href should be defined between signs < and >.
Question 10 - About comments in an HTML document:
Comments in HTML are defined in <-- comment --> being ignored by the browser.
Comments in HTML are defined between <!-- Comment --> being ignored by the browser.
